title: Pierre Amadieu 2014 Domaine Grand Romane  (Gigondas)
description: Fleshy black-cherry and plum flavors verge on the overripe in this supple, rounded wine. Ripe tannins, caramel and spice accentuate the soft, easy drinking appeal.

title: Plumb Cellars 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of herb, vanilla, pencil lead, barrel spice and coffee are followed by sleek but well-proportioned fruit flavors. It shows a lovely sense of balance, though the barrel influence plays a large part in the show.

title: Savignola Paolina 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, cedar and tilled earth lead the nose while the chewy palate offers black currant, mocha and baking spice. Assertive but fine-grained tannins lend support. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Silver Thread 2016 Doyle Fournier Vineyard Riesling (Seneca Lake)
description: The most plush of Silver Thread's single-vineyard lineup this vintage, this wine shows a wealth of ripe stone fruit, blended with milky, white flowers and crushed stone on the nose. A roundness on the off-dry palate is carried by fleshy yellow apple and tart apricot, balanced by a vein of lemon-lime acidity. A powdered mineral texture lingers through the finish.

title: Spioenkop 2015 Riesling (Elgin)
description: This is slightly shy and reserved off the bat, but expresses itself more with some time in the glass, yielding scents of melon rind, underripe peach and lightly spiced citrus rind. There's a gorgeous texture to the palate, with a subtle pithiness and grassy astringency that frames the stone-fruit flavors. Drink now–2021.

title: Steindorfer 2015 Kaiserberg Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: A wave red and black cherry comes across as rather fleshy on the nose. The palate is fresh and juicy with all of that fleshy, ripe fruit flooding across the palate. The customary Austrian freshness provides a welcome counterbalance while the tannins are soft and pliable. Drink soon.

title: Tenuta San Mauro 2012 Canova  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of scorched earth, toast, espresso and balsamic notes fill the glass. The full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, raspberry jam, cinnamon and clove framed in firm, close-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: The Seeker 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine starts out seemingly semisweet, with a touch of honey, florals and ripe lemon. The palate, however, is dry, with medium weight, zippy acidity, a creamy, slippery texture and a citrusy finish. Sip with roast chicken.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2015 Blend 33 White (Central Coast)
description: This blend of 38% Roussanne, 31% Marsanne and 31% Viognier is a Rhône-style white for Chardonnay lovers, starting with an intriguingly buttery and toast-filled nose that's cut with aromas of squeezed lemon. The palate is bolstered by a citrusy acidity and decent textural grip, finishing on melted butter.

title: Valiano 2015  Chianti Classico
description: This supple red opens with aromas of iris, red-skinned berry and underbrush. The juicy palate delivers red berry, white pepper and a hint of star anise cushioned between rounded tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Vignoble Charmet 2016 Moulin la Blanche  (Beaujolais)
description: This is a full wine, juicy with attractive blackberry and rich cherry fruit. Its acidity provides a refreshing contrast to the richness. Drink the wine now.

title: Viña Aquitania 2014 Lazuli Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: A tough gritty nose is not the most welcoming, while this holds onto that hardness on the palate, which is raw in feel and stylistically more drawn back than most high-end Chilean Cabernets. This tastes savory, a touch leafy and short on ripe fruit. Overall, it's a dry Maipo red with oak character and toughness. Drink through 2028.

title: Viña Casablanca 2014 Neblus Red (Casablanca Valley)
description: This Syrah and Merlot blend goes heavy on the Syrah and the dark color. The nose is intense, spicy and concentrated, with creamy mint notes stemming from fruit and oak. A heavy palate is a clunky, while strong flavors of mint, grassy berry and sappy black plum are roasted and slightly herbaceous on the finish. All in all, Neblus is a rare breed of wine.

title: Cabana Wines 2014 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Like a home-baked apple pie without the sweetness, this light-bodied wine smells of sliced apples, nutmeg and cinnamon and tastes fruity and lightly spicy. The texture is very smooth and gentle, too.

title: Colle Bereto 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this has subdued aromas of baking spice, meat juice and black-skinned fruit. The firm palate offers black cherry, raspberry jam and clove alongside tightly knit tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Domaine Chasselay 2016 L'Héronde  (Côte de Brouilly)
description: This ripe and richly fruity wine from organically grown grapes is also textured with tannins and cut with acidity. These elements make for a generous wine, full of fruit and with a medium-term future. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Domaine de la Plaigne 2016  Morgon
description: Perfumed red fruits and firm tannins give this wine both its immediate attraction and its aging potential. It is dense as well as rich with juicy blackberry fruit freshened with acidity. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2016  Fleurie
description: This small family-owned estate has vines in both Morgon and Fleurie. This elegant wine is poised between ripe tannins and generous black fruit. It will age for a few more months, allowing time for its bright acidity to soften. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Casaloste 2011 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of toast, vanilla and violet are front and center on this 100% Sangiovese. The concentrated palate doles out black cherry jam, star anise and licorice alongside pliant tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Cecchi 2014 Riserva di Famiglia  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, blue flower and white pepper. The vibrant palate doles out ripe black cherry, star anise and a hint of espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Cecchi 2015 Storia di Famiglia  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made with 90% Sangiovese, 5% Colorino and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, this opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, leather and white pepper. The juicy palate doles out ripe red cherry, clove, star anise and a touch of espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Château de Lacarelle 2016  Beaujolais-Villages
description: This wine is ripe, full and juicy from 30-year-old vines. It is packed with rich tannins and black-cherry flavors that are generous and full in the mouth. This warm, well-made wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaine du Penlois 2016 du Châtelard  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: This is a ripe, creamy and already delicious wine. Refreshing acidity pairs with a zesty character to provide both minerality and great fruitiness. The wine needs to age a few more months, and will be just right from mid-2018.

title: Elio Filippino 2007 Serra Capelli 10 Anni Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: You'll find aromas of forest floor, exotic spice, oak, leather and a whiff of game o this concentrated red. The hearty, monolithic palate presents dried cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of evident alcohol. Drink through 2022.

title: Eradus 2016 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Awatere Valley)
description: Enjoy this pretty, light-bodied wine chilling down on a warm day. Bright, ripe strawberry and red cherry notes dominate, with a hint of florals and cracked pepper at the back. This is well-structured by lively acidity and a savory finish.

title: Esk Valley 2016 Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)
description: After some time in the glass, this reveals its true colors of lime, flint and wet stone, along with brioche, nuts and toasty oak aromas. The medium-weighted palate comes with prickly acidity and a limey tang, making this an excellent wine to pair with a meal.

title: Fabien Collonge 2016 L'Aurore des Côtes  (Chiroubles)
description: This is a cool, crisp wine from vineyards that face east to the rising sun. Its red-cherry fruitiness and acidity are bright with touches of tannin to give the wine shape. It needs a few months for the fruit to calm down from its intensity. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Fattoria San Michele a Torri 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Ripe red berry, crushed aromatic herb and baking spice aromas segue over to the juicy, savory palate along with blackberry and star anise. Supple tannins provide relaxed support.

title: Flaherty 2014 Red (Aconcagua Costa)
description: Syrah is the lead grape on this blend that opens with wild berry, animal fur and creamy oak aromas. A narrow concentrated palate doesn't display a lot of structure, while this tastes of ripe plum with brown-sugar sweetness. There's grip but little expansion to the finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine Mont Chavy  (Morgon)
description: This is a chewy wine, still powered with the typical tannins of a young Morgon. The domaine has vines in the Charmes and Corcelette sub-regions, giving a serious structure as well as great black fruits. Drink from 2019.
